channel.title: Digg Top Stories
channel.description: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

item.title: How Pi Was Nearly Changed To 3.2 And Copyrighted
item.description: This story has all the makings of weirdo Americana: bad amateur science, commercial ventures based upon the same, and a state legislature eager to embrace it all.

item.title: North Korean Video Features Its Army Taking 150,000 American Hostages
item.description: North Korea released a new promotional video in which the DPRK's army stages a massive attack on South Korea with paratroopers landing in Seoul and proceeding to take 150,000 U.S. citizens hostage.

item.title: Blackberry CEO Calls iPhone Outdated, Manages To Keep A Straight Face
item.description: Thorsten Heins made a comment that raised some eyebrows on the eve of the much-delayed launch of the new touchscreen BlackBerry in the United States.

item.title: Shooting At Quantico Leaves 3 Dead, Including Gunman
item.description: A Marine shot and killed two of his fellow service members at a Virginia base on Thursday night before turning the gun on himself.

item.title: When The Whole World Has Drones
item.description: The precedents the U.S. has set for robotic warfare may have fearsome consequences as other countries catch up.

item.title: These Two Seconds Of Hockey Generated 44 Penalty Minutes
item.description: Want to watch something exciting and unusual that happened on the ice during an NHL game? Watch this video! Want to watch some hockey? Well, then don't watch this video.

item.title: The Day Child Porn Went Viral On Facebook
item.description: A video of unknown origin appearing to show a grown man sexually abusing an infant girl went viral overnight on Facebook, garnering as many as 32,000 shares and over 5,000 likes before finally being removed by the website.

item.title: The Secret Gingrich-Santorum 'Unity Ticket' That Nearly Toppled Romney
item.description: It’s one of the great untold stories of the 2012 presidential campaign, a tale of ego and intrigue that nearly upended the Republican primary contest and might even have produced a different nominee: As Mitt Romney struggled in the weeks leading up to the Michigan primary, Newt Gingrich and Rick Santorum nearly agreed to form a joint “Unity Ticket” to consolidate conservative support and topple Romney.

item.title: How One Brave Skateboarder Jumped Over The Subway Tracks
item.description: It's not fake, but it was scary, said the photographer Allen Ying, who took the shot from below, on the tracks.

item.title: The Inhalable 'Whisky Tornado' That Can Get You Drunk
item.description: Ever feel like getting drunk but don't want to actually consume any liquids? There's now a solution to this non-existant problem.

item.title: Newly Discovered Letter By Oscar Wilde Contains Writing Tips From The Author
item.description: Oscar Wilde believed his success as a writer was due to him never relying on the craft as a source of income, a previously unseen letter by the author has revealed.

item.title: Why Mini-Skirts Could Become Illegal In South Korea
item.description: In the 1970s, the dictatorship controlling South Korea stipulated the length of women's skirts. Now, due to a new law, some in South Korea worry that those days are returning.

item.title: Do Conservatives Or Liberals Have Better Gaydar?
item.description: Luckily, there's a new study out that answers this very important question.

item.title: The Life Of A Gun Repo Man
item.description: California is the only state that takes legally obtained weapons away from citizens who are no longer supposed to have them. Meet the team that performs this dangerous task.

item.title: Is It Legal To Appear In Public Wearing Only Body Paint?
item.description: The clothing retailer American Eagle posted an advertisement for spray-on jeans on its website this week, calling the product “our skinniest jeans ever.” The ad appears to be a prank, but painting models is now old hat. Is it legal to appear in public wearing nothing but body paint?

item.title: Gay Marriage Opponents' Obsession With Sex
item.description: For them, marriage is no longer about love or parenting. It's about penises and vaginas.

item.title: Is There Such A Thing As Photographic Memory?
item.description: It’s the kind of thing that seems too good to be true; does anyone really have a memory as accurate as a camera?

item.title: We Now Live In A World Where More People Have Mobile Phones Than Clean Toilets
item.description: Surprisingly, the UN reports there are now more people with mobile phones (six billion for world population of seven billion) on earth than there are with access to clean toilets (4.5 billion).

item.title: Don't Hate CISPA
item.description: Cybersecurity and privacy should not be mutually exclusive.

item.title: Apple Removes Sweatshop iOS Game Because It Made Them Uncomfortable
item.description: When Apple removes a game or other app from the App Store it’s usually because one or more of the many rules has been broken. But in the case of Sweatshop HD, the game just made Apple uncomfortable, and it’s hard to argue your case as a developer against that.

item.title: What A Poverty Line Budget Buys You Around The World
item.description: What happens when a photographer and an economist work together to document poverty around the world? When Stefen Chow and his wife, Hui-yi Lin, set out to answer that question, they came up with a photo project, The Poverty Line.

item.title: Google Is Building A Smartwatch
item.description: According to a recent report, Google might also be getting into the smartwatch game.

item.title: 'Baghdad Bob' And His Ridiculous, True Predictions
item.description: Ten years later, Iraq's insane-sounding information minister turns out to be quite the soothsayer.

item.title: What If Marriage Were Temporary?
item.description: With the divorce rate hovering between 40 and 50 percent, one could argue half of marriages are temporary, anyway.

item.title: Mapping The Early Universe
item.description: The Planck satellite has taken the most detailed images yet of the early universe.

item.title: Shepard Fairey Obeys Space Station Request To Create Mission Badges
item.description: He’s made indelible images for President Obama AND Neil Young. Next stop: outer space.t

item.title: How To Get Hot, Fresh Fries Each And Every Time
item.description: You know how sometimes you’ll go to McDonald’s and the fries are absolutely amazing, warm and crisp and just the best, best fries you’ve ever had? And other times, they taste like a stale, mushy vat of the Mondays?

item.title: The Wil Wheaton Story That Will Make You Sob In Your Cheerios
item.description: Last night, I was checking Facebook on my phone, when I ran across a story that many of you have may have also seen on your Facebook walls. I’m not sure what compelled me to read it, but five minutes later, my heart may have swollen 3 sizes and there was definitely something in my eye.
